text: Tagging Carter is also always a go to for me. :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

Hey team

Small issue for the backlog - not urgent.
Experiencing some issues with ButtonGroups. It seems that if they get minimised, they never open again - e.g. when resizing the window or opening/closing the right-hand sidebar.
I’m thinking you could also cache in HubDb. Might not be super smooth, but it’d work.

Hi Magnus! Happy to take a look at any potential issues in the ButtonRow component. A few clarifying questions:
• Is the sample above being used in the middle pane?
• Is the ButtonRow nested within any other components?
• How many Buttons are contained within the ButtonRow?
Hi <@U07S4T5TCT0>, we are improving the experience as we go. Are you a marketplace app partner?
<@U06H94JKK1P> what role do you work as in your company?
Yes. It'll take a couple of days before we approve you, but we try to do it as soon as we can

<@U063P3TKE3V> May I ask you, what was your process to learn about public apps? I see that you missed the information about data fetching. Knowing your flow, would help us understand how we can make it better.
Would you mind showing me a quick demo of what you built? My email is <mailto:sparikh@HubSpot.com|sparikh@HubSpot.com>

Hello Arrigo, yes, that was for the older JSON-based schema that have been now deprecated. We are considering playground again, but we also have a Figma design kit, that you may want to check out, that serves some of the purpose of mocking up extensions

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/ui-components/figma-design-kit>
Are they still facing this issue?
<@U07S3TXQ0SZ> is your issue resolved?

Thank you, Arrigo, this is on our radar and I will inform here when we get there.

Are you a marketplace app developer? If so, have you already pushed out an app with new app cards?
+1 to what Kiara mentioned. <@U03BA1PRV7S> can you please add more details on your use case?

<@UAX5LJ9K3> <@U07RS65ADU7>, thank you for bringing in useful feedback for us. For your app, may I know what is the level of data processing do you have? Do you fetch HubSpot data, and combine with third-party data to process and generate more insights, or is it more of CRUD operations? Do you also prefer to do data operations on the client side or server side?
Hi Killean, do you still face this issue?
I am afraid not. May I know your use case for settings iframe?
Well its probably a bad case but we wanted to create a card to associate leads with custom objects and show associated custom objects because its not possible through the UI yet.

Yes, I'm a marketplace developer, our UI extensions were just approved from the app card review team :slightly_smiling_face:
The app we've developed is <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/simple-time-tracker|Simple Time Tracker>—with 4 app cards included.

Yes, we are using the Figma kit indeed.
I did find the playground useful for development though.

Sort of like a Storybook where I can grab the code configuration based on immediate visual feedback :slightly_smiling_face:
It's not a deal-breaker, just a thought.
